meta.title: COVID-19 - Westlake City School District

div.div: Download the Westlake Schools AppStay updated 24/7/365 with the Westlake Schools mobile app designed to enable everyone to stay informed on important issues, information and activities underway within our schools. The free Westlake Schools app is available for download in the Google Play Store for Android and in the App Store for Apple products. Look for the green & white "W."
Our Schools Westlake's schools offer a wide variety of rigorous programs designed to prepare students for achieving excellence and charting the path for their future.
Leadership Westlake City Schools is fortunate to have a team of leadership professionals who are committed to carrying on our mission of educating for excellence.

Westlake Board of Education The Board of Education functions as the governing body of the school district. Responsibilities include hiring the superintendent, setting district policy, approving the district budget, establishing goals and accountability standards, and promoting involvement in our schools.

Demon AthleticsWestlake's athletic program is built on a solid foundation of strong teams, talented players, dedicated coaches, enthusiastic parents and proud alumni supporters. The essentials of teamwork, skill development, positive attitude, school spirit, physical fitness and sportsmanship are addressed on the field and off. Our coaches work to show that what is learned on the field or court is applicable to the classroom and throughout life.

Arts
The Westlake Schools offers a wide variety of options in the performing arts, including Concert Band, Orchestra, Jazz Band, Marching Band, Symphonic Band, Demonette & Debonaire. Students can explore a new instrument, sing in a number of choirs, or perform as a member of the cast in a theater production.

In light of the current information about coronavirus disease-19 (COVID-19), WCSD is using this opportunity to review our school safety plans and address the health, safety and well-being of our students and staff. We are committed to making all decisions in the best interest of the health and safety of students and the community. As a precaution we are:

ul.li: Remaining in close contact with local, state and federal health agencies on local health emergency procedures in our community to be proactive in decision-making.
Communicating about our preparedness through the WCSD website, SchoolMessenger notifications and social media.

div.p: The district continues to monitor health warnings and travel advisories surrounding the coronavirus. We will communicate anything that applies to our school community as quickly as possible through all of our communication channels.
The Ohio Department of Health established a Call Center staffed by licensed nurses and infectious disease experts to answer questions regarding coronavirus, 9am-8pm daily.

Out of an abundance of caution and in keeping with guidance issued by state, local and federal health departments, WCSD has canceled all school programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events until further notice. This includes kindergarten registration. Please refer to the website for updated event information.
During the closure, Westlake spring athletes are not to participate on any non-interscholastic teams (summer or travel), as the OHSAA will still view these athletes as in-season.

The Ohio Department of Health developed these Frequently Asked Questions, based on information from ODH, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and Ohio Department of Education, to help Ohio’s schools and districts consider local preparedness and action-planning steps necessary to carefully and effectively prepare for and respond to a possible coronavirus outbreak.
The District is taking a number of precautions to minimize the risk to our students, staff and families:

ul.li: We are asking all of our families to monitor their student’s health, as well as their own. If their child is sick with flu-like systems, we are recommending that parents and guardians seek medical treatment and keep the child home from school. We are also asking staff and visitors to follow these same precautions.
Our custodial staff is doubling its effort to ensure that high-touch surfaces are being disinfected. Additionally, our Transportation Department cleans and disinfects buses daily.
We continue to evaluate all upcoming District-sponsored domestic and international travel.
We are developing plans in the event that we are forced to close schools.

div.p: We encourage all students, staff and community members to follow these recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control:

ul.li: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.
Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol content.
Stay at home if you are sick.
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, and throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

a.title: school closure extended
a.strong: Coronavirus Update: School Closure Extended Through May 1

div.p: March 30, 2020 - This afternoon, Gov. Mike DeWine extended his order on school closures through the end of the month. Schools will remain closed through May 1. This means that distance learning for Westlake City Schools will continue through that time.

a.title: Distance Learning Launch
a.strong: Coronavirus Update: WCSD Launches Distance Learning

hr.p: March 19, 2020 - This afternoon the Westlake City School District launched its distance learning program in response to the closure of schools due to COVID-19.
March 12, 2020 - This afternoon, Gov. Mike DeWine announced that students in Ohio will not report to school for three weeks due to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.
March 12, 2020 - The Westlake Schools are canceling classes on Tuesday, March 17, to provide a day of planning and preparation for our teachers.

h6.a: Coronavirus Update: Safeguarding Student & Staff Exposure

hr.p: March 11, 2020 - Updates and guidance on field trips, student attendance and events impacted by health officials' decisions to safeguard student and staff exposure to COVID-19.

h6.a: Coronavirus Update: Working Together for Prevention & Preparedness

hr.p: March 10, 2020 - COVID-19, referenced in news reports as the novel coronavirus, is a respiratory illness caused by a novel (new) virus, and we are learning more about it every day.

h6.a: Coronavirus Message: Keeping Our Schools Healthy

hr.p: Feb. 28, 2020 - A message to families about proactive steps the district is taking to maintain a healthy learning environment.

div.p: The Westlake City School District will provide a dynamic, student-centered, 21st Century learning environment. Our district will be characterized by high achievement, actively engaged learners, mutual respect, shared knowledge, pursuit of new skills and capabilities, collaborative learning, willingness to take action, a team commitment to data-driven continuous improvement, and tangible results.
